original_title: Sri Lanka extends DDR closing date
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has extended a closing date for domestic debt exchange following feedback of eligible bond holders.
The offer will now close on 11 August instead of the first announced 25 July.

Sri Lanka is offering to exchange Treasury bonds held by pension funds with longer term instruments, as well as Treasury bills bought by the central bank to print money and trigger forex shortages and default.
The settlement date will now be August 17 from an earlier July 31.
